items.title: Hurricane Melissa Has Arrived in Cuba
items.summary: The storm hit Jamaica as one of the strongest Atlantic hurricanes ever.

items.title: Radio Free Asia Will Halt News Operations Amid Shutdown
items.summary: Until this month, Radio Free Asia had successfully resisted Trump officials who had tried to render it obsolete.

items.title: South Korea Says the United States Agreed to 15% Tariffs
items.summary: Seoul will invest $200 billion, or as much as $20 billion a year, and set aside another $150 billion to invest in its American shipbuilding operations, a South Korean official said.

items.title: In Utah, Trump’s Vision for Homelessness Begins to Take Shape
items.summary: State officials promise large-scale involuntary addiction and mental health treatment at Salt Lake City’s edge. Critics see “a prison, or a warehouse.”

items.title: In Mississippi, Democrats Hope New Maps Lead to Statehouse Wins
items.summary: A federal court says Republican legislators diluted Black voter strength. New maps may help Democrats break the G.O.P. supermajority in Jackson on Nov. 4.

items.title: What College Students Are Worried About Right Now
items.summary: As political battles upend college campuses, we asked dozens of students what is on their minds as they plan for the future. Politics was only part of it.

items.title: ‘No Trump’ protests in South Korea as US president finalises trade deal with Lee Jae Myung - US politics live
items.summary: <p>Progressive groups and opposition politicians hold anti-US protest as Donald Trump sounds optimistic note about China summit</p><p>Donald Trump has fired all six members of an independent federal agency responsible for reviewing his controversial White House ballroom and planned <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/16/donald-trump-washington-arch">‘Arc de Trump’</a> in Washington DC, according to reports.</p><p>The Washington Post <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2025/10/28/trump-arts-commission-firings-ballroom-arch/">reported</a> that all members of the Commission of Fine Arts were dismissed on Tuesday.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/oct/29/donald-trump-south-korea-china-latest-news-updates-live">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: Trump fires federal arts board in charge of reviewing White House ballroom and ‘Arc de Trump’
items.summary: <p>All six members of the independent Commission of Fine Arts were reportedly dismissed Tuesday</p><p>Donald Trump has fired all six members of an independent federal agency responsible for reviewing his controversial White House ballroom and planned <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/16/donald-trump-washington-arch">‘Arc de Trump’</a> in Washington DC, according to reports.</p><p>The Washington Post <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2025/10/28/trump-arts-commission-firings-ballroom-arch/">reported</a> that all members of the Commission of Fine Arts were dismissed on Tuesday.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/29/trump-fires-arts-board-arc-ballroom">Continue reading...</a>
